body_html:
For example, if you took the sum of your price data, then adjusted the window, then recomputed the sum, TensorFlow, would recompute the entire sum, whereas you would probably prefer it to simply subtract the entries that were removed from the window, and add the entries that entered the window.

I did not have this in mind then I opened this issue but it is a good suggestion which will be useful to me also hence I opened: #6690
body_text:
For example, if you took the sum of your price data, then adjusted the window, then recomputed the sum, TensorFlow, would recompute the entire sum, whereas you would probably prefer it to simply subtract the entries that were removed from the window, and add the entries that entered the window.

I did not have this in mind then I opened this issue but it is a good suggestion which will be useful to me also hence I opened: #6690
body:
>  For example, if you took the sum of your price data, then adjusted the window, then recomputed the sum, TensorFlow, would recompute the entire sum, whereas you would probably prefer it to simply subtract the entries that were removed from the window, and add the entries that entered the window.

I did not have this in mind then I opened this issue but it is a good suggestion which will be useful to me also hence I opened: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6690
